findings.title: ERC-777 tokens can re-enter TokenBridge’s deposit function and bridge an unlimited amount of tokens
findings.description: An attacker can abuse ERC-777 token transfer hooks to re-enter the deposit function over and over, artificially inflating the amount of bridged tokens due to TokenBridge caching the token balance before transfer.

findings.title: No Check for Initializing Parameters of TokenBridge
findings.description: In `TokenBridge` contract’s `initialize` function, there is no check for initializing parameters including `_securityCouncil`, `_messageService`, `_tokenBeacon` and `_reservedTokens`. If any of these address is set to 0 or other invalid value, TokenBridge would not work, user may lose funds.
